title: Get started
text: start analysis first need prepare DGrowthR::DGrowthR() object. , require two sources information: 1. Growth data. 2. Metadata. go details one.

title: Get started
text: DGrowthR can used analyse growth data multi-well plate readers. Depending specific platform used, actual output machine might look slightly different. DGrowthR assumes data consists simultaneous measurements growth, preferably regularly interspaced. means growth across wells measured time , ideally, time measurements always . data measured regular intervals, DGrowthR still able analyze data. Examples kinds data can used can seen Source Data folder. ** example data collected one 384 well plate Brenzinger 2024. dataframe used directly build DGrowthR::DGrowthR() object. important features include: ** column called Time: values column indicate time OD measurements made wells plate. units Time column (seconds, minutes, hours) taken . unit conversion performed DGrowthR. Columns indicating wells: columns besides Time column indicate wells plate. values measured optical density well specific time point. arbitrary number wells can present (typically 384 96). Typically, well identified combination uppercase letter followed number, spaces. information used identify individual growth curve. Source_Data/Brenzinger_2024/wt_1_OD.txt stated , data frame used directly DGrowthR.
code: # Read example data from Brenzinger 2024 example_brenzinger <- read.delim("../Source_Data/Brenzinger_2024/od_data/wt_1_OD.txt",                                   sep = '\t')  tibble(example_brenzinger) %>%    rmarkdown::paged_table()

previous_headings: Preparing your data for DGrowthR. > Growth data.
what: What if I want to analyze data from multiple plates?.
title: Get started
text: definitely possible DGrowthR. just couple things keep mind: data plate separate files. assumed measurements taken roughly timepoints across plates. means Time column roughly plates. Due small variations different plate measurements, values Time column might slightly different. growth curve now identified combination {plate name}_{well}. order read data multiple plates, harmonize Time column, assign individual curve identifiers way can used DGrowthR, provide standalone function called read_multiple_plates(). , use read data Brenzinger 2024 study. case know 20 measurements taken; time first second measurement ~2 hours, followed regular 44 minute intervals. can help us create common time vector files. output function list two data frames. First “od_data” data frame. can see, common Time column individual growth curve remaining columns. growth now identified curve_id built {plate_name}_{well}, plate_name actually just name file data read, without extension. total 20 measurements 2,304 (384 * 6) growth curves! Additionally, “metadata” data frame provided. data frame explains curve_id coming . plate name (file name without extension) original well explicitly mentioned. sets us nicely now discuss metadata.
code: # Create common time vector common_time_vector <- c(0, 2, seq(from=2.739, by=0.739, length.out=18))   # Read all OD data brenzinger_data <- read_multiple_plates(path_target = "../Source_Data/Brenzinger_2024/od_data/",                                         time_vector = common_time_vector) #> The following OD data was found: dCBASS_1_OD.txt, dCBASS_2_OD.txt, dCBASS_3_OD.txt, wt_1_OD.txt, wt_2_OD.txt, wt_3_OD.txt # Show the first five columns of the complete OD data brenzinger_od <- brenzinger_data[["od_data"]]    brenzinger_od %>%    rmarkdown::paged_table() brenzinger_metadata <- brenzinger_data[["metadata"]]    brenzinger_metadata %>%    rmarkdown::paged_table()

title: Get started
text: metadata contains information relevant experimental setup. information contained can quite arbitrary suit needs researcher. example, can contain information conditions growth curve measured, replicate number, batch number, etc. Importantly, must column named curve_id, contains names growth curves present data frame optical density information. case, use information genotype, compound concentration provided original study. Now lot information conditions growth curve gathered. sources information, can now build DGrowthR::DGrowthR() object.
code: # Information about each plate database.df <- read_tsv("../Source_Data/Brenzinger_2024/Database.txt",                          show_col_types = FALSE) %>%    separate(Strain, into = c("genotype", NA)) %>%    select(file_id, genotype, Rep_Nr) %>%    mutate(plate_name = tools::file_path_sans_ext(file_id))  # Information about each well mapper.df <- read_tsv("../Source_Data/Brenzinger_2024/Map.txt",                        show_col_types = FALSE) %>%    rename("well" = "Well")   # Add this information to the metadata data frame brenzinger_metadata <- brenzinger_metadata %>%    left_join(database.df, by="plate_name") %>%    left_join(mapper.df, by="well") %>%    unite("genotype_well", c(genotype, well), sep="_", remove=FALSE)  brenzinger_metadata %>%    rmarkdown::paged_table()

title: Get started
text: satisfied growth data metadata data frames, can instantiate DgrowthR() object DgrowthRFromData() function. now DGrowthR object. heart package. functions require DGrowthR object input. example, can quickly visually inspect data using plot_growth_curves() function.  can inspect growth curves using variables metadata facet color parameters.  ’s worth mentioning plots returned DGrowthR functions ggplot objects. Meaning may customize liking using ggplot syntax functions. Now data ready can start pre-processing.
code: # Instantiate a DGrowthR object dgobj <- DGrowthRFromData(od_data = brenzinger_od,                           metadata = brenzinger_metadata) #> Creating a DGrowthR object... #> 2304 growth curves. #> 20 timepoints. #> 8 covariates (including well). plot_growth_curves(dgobj) plot_growth_curves(dgobj, facet="plate_name", color="genotype")

title: Get started
text: Pre-processing growth curves essential performing analysis. done preprocess_data() function. following transformations performed: First user may specify initial growth measurements ignored skip_first_n_timepoints parameter. growth curves shortened start timepoint skip_first_n_timepoints + 1. optical density measurements log-transformed. enables accurate estimation growth parameters maximum specific growth rate, end lag phase, etc. log linear scaled data conserved. Baseline correction performed subtracting initial OD measurement rest growth curve. can see data transformed.  Notice now y-axis starts 0.
code: dgobj <- preprocess_data(dgobj) #> Log-transforming the growth measurements... #> Using OD from timepoint 1 as baseline. plot_growth_curves(dgobj, facet="plate_name", color="genotype")

title: Get started
text: Now pre-processed data can compute low-dimensional representation data. DGrowthR offers possibility either functional PCA, UMAP embedding. Now can plot representations see observe     looking interesting. One can investigate captured coloring given covariate metadata.  One can also visualize certain growth parameters calculated DGrowthR. discussed next section.
code: dgobj <- estimate_fpca(dgobj) #> [DGrowthR::estimate_fpca] >> Estimating functional Principal Components #> [DGrowthR::estimate_fpca] >> Embedding optical density data #> Warning in CheckData(Ly, Lt): There is a time gap of at least 10% of the #> observed range across subjects dgobj <- estimate_umap(dgobj) #> [DGrowthR::estimate_umap] >> Estimating functional UMAP #> [DGrowthR::estimate_umap] >> Embedding optical density data plot_fpca(dgobj) plot_umap(dgobj) plot_fpca(dgobj) plot_umap(dgobj) plot_umap(dgobj, color = "genotype")

title: Get started
text: One can cluster growth curves based low-dimensinal embeddings fPCA UMAP. acheived `  Since know clustering individual growth curves, can plot growth curves updated metadata  course one can play around clustering changing UMAP fPCA embedding parameters, also clustering parameters .
code: # Clustering based on FPCA coordinates dgobj <- clustering(dgobj, embedding="fpca") #> Clustering using fPCA coordinates... #> [DGrowthR::clustering] >> Density based clustering with DBSCAN #> [DGrowthR::clustering] >> Using K-nearest neighbors: 23 #> [DGrowthR::clustering] >> Automatic determination of optimal eps... #> [DGrowthR::clustering] >> Using eps value: 0.258811281594046 #> [DGrowthR::clustering] >> Updating cluster_assignment slot.. #> [DGrowthR::clustering] >> Finished   # Now you can plot cluster assignment plot_fpca(dgobj, color = "cluster_assignment") plot_growth_curves(dgobj, facet="cluster_assignment", color="genotype")

title: Get started
text: Now explored data bit, can get growth statistics data. principle, directly pre-processing. One main features DGrowthR htat assume specific functional form growth curves. means can flexibly model growth curves follow typical sigmoidal shape. Briefly, Gaussian Process (GP) fit growth data (use laGP package ), main growth statistics gathered mean posterior. growth parameters computed : max_growth: maximum growth achieved. max_growth_time: Time max_growth reached. AUC: empirical area curve. growth_loss: maximum decrease growth moment maximum growth. max_growth_rate_timepoint: Time maximum growth rate acheived. max_growth_rate: maximum specific growth rate. doubling_time: Equal log(2)/max_growth_ratelog(2)/\text{max_growth_rate}. max_death_rate_timepoint: Time lowest growth rate observed. max_death_rate: Maximum rate death. Properly speaking lowest growth rate. lag_phase_timepoint: Time lag phase ends exponential growth begins. find maximum second derivative max_growth_rate_timepoint. growth_at_lag_phase: Amount growth lag phase ends. stationary_phase_timepoint: Time stationary phase starts. find minimum second derivative max_growth_rate_timepoint. typical growth curve, correspond beginning stationary phase. 13 growth_at_stationary_phase: amount growth stationary_phase_timepoint. KEEP MIND values reported units used modelling. Since data log transformed pre-processing, growth parameters units log(OD). estimate growth parameters, can use estimate_growth_parameters() function. default, function models gathers growth parameters individual curve saves @growth_parameters slot. can view . can see, gpfit_id field corresponds curve_id. actually update low-dimensional embeddings data now.

title: Get started
text: One additional advantage using GP model curves can now model several growth curves time! Instead modelling one curve time, can jointly model replicate curves gathered experimental conditions. example, Brenzinger 2024 analyse response Δ\DeltaCBASS strain wildtype confronted different compounds. can jointly analyse growth curves coming genotype_compound combination. Now gpfit_id indicates group modelled. Additionally, also indicated save mean GP posterior. can now accessed @gpfit_info field. can also now plot information .  Yet another great trick can sample posterior GP gather arbitrary number synthetic growth curves. can gather growth statistics sampled curves get mean standard deviation growth parameters. Keep mind makes sense modeled covariate contains one growth curve per group. Now can see growth statistics mean standard deviation.

title: Get started
text: One main features DGrowthR ability compare growth curves gathered different experimental conditions. done via likelihood ratio test. Briefly, two GP models fit: null model growth curves modeled jointly, alternative model additional covariate added design matrix indicating whether growth curve come reference treatment condition. log-likelihood two models compared, giving us likelihood ratio test statistic. DgrowthR steps can run growth_comparison() function. comparison indicated comparison_info parameter vector consisting (metatada_field, treatment_value, reference_value). metadata field field metadata, treatment reference values found said field. groups growth curves compared eachother described . Following example, can compare genotype affects response compound. see result comparison. likelihood_ratio: Indicates test statistic likelihood ratio test. equal llik.alternative_model - llik.null_model. llik.alternative_model: log-likelihood GP fit alternative model. llik.null_model: log-likelihood GP fit null model. AUC.treatment: AUC alternative model fit treatment growth curves. AUC.reference: AUC alternative model fit reference growth curves. AUC.FoldChange: Equal AUC.treatmentAUC.reference\frac{\text{AUC.treatment}}{\text{AUC.reference}}. max_growth.treatment: Maximum growth determined alternative model fit treatment growth curves. max_growth.reference: Maximum growth determined alternative model fit reference growth curves. max_growth.FoldChange: Equal max_growth.treatmentmax_growth.reference\frac{\text{max_growth.treatment}}{\text{max_growth.reference}}. euclidean.distance: euclidean distance model fit treatment alternative curves. can get better intuition looking visual representation model. see fit null model, growth curves modelled jointly, independent genotype. can clearly see fit poor.  alternative model fits original growth curves much better, indicating two groups might significantly different.  course, point visual evidence significant difference. can get statistical significance performing permutation test. DGrowthR permutation test consists randomly shuffling label growth curve computing log-likelihood alternative GP model curves shuffled. several times can give us idea distribution likelihood ratio test statistic curves randomly assigned. case can set permutation_test parameter indicate number permutations like perform. can see , new field added results empirical_p.value. empirical p-value calculated fraction premuted test statistics larger observed test statistic. can see empirical_p.value 0.009, quite good considering lowest possible p-value setup. can get visual inspection null vs observed test statistic  can also plot difference reference treatment condition time

title: Get started
text: Now let’s imagine actually want make several comparisons one go. can use multiple_comparisons function. actually quite similar function now provide list contains comparisons want make Now can view results one data.frame shown . also now pvalue.adjust field performs BH correction empirical_p.value field tests done. good get started!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Medina Feldl. Author, maintainer. Roberto Olayo Alarcon. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Feldl M, Olayo Alarcon R (2025). DGrowthR: Bacterial Growth Curve Analysis. R package version 1.0, https://github.com/bio-datascience/DGrowthR/, https://bio-datascience.github.io/DGrowthR/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {DGrowthR: Bacterial Growth Curve Analysis},   author = {Medina Feldl and Roberto {Olayo Alarcon}},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0, https://github.com/bio-datascience/DGrowthR/},   url = {https://bio-datascience.github.io/DGrowthR/}, }

title: Bacterial Growth Curve Analysis
text: repository hosts DGrowthR R package workflow detailed analysis publicly available datasets mentioned pre-print. workflow designed showcase application DGrowthR package model complex, non-linear dynamics bacterial growth using Gaussian Process Regression.  [!TIP] details, check pre-print Statistical end--end analysis large-scale microbial growth data DGrowthR bioRxiv. DGrowthR also available standalone Desktop-App Windows Apple (https://zenodo.org/records/15118187).

title: Bacterial Growth Curve Analysis
text: install DGrowthR R package directly repository. First make sure clone repository enter cloned folder. can execute following commands R. Ensure devtools package installed. , can install using following command Use install function install DGrowthR package:
code: # Install devtools install.packages("devtools")  # Load the library library(devtools) install()

title: Bacterial Growth Curve Analysis
text: overview main functionalities DGrowthR concrete examples can found tutorial vignette

text: Additionally, see analysis publicly available datasets Brochado 2018 Brenzinger 2024 studies. steps workflow folder

what: This S4 class represents a DGrowthR model. — DGrowthR-class
title: This S4 class represents a DGrowthR model. — DGrowthR-class
text: used store validate data parameters necessary DGrowthR analysis.

title: This S4 class represents a DGrowthR model. — DGrowthR-class
text: od_data data.frame expected contain following columns: "timepoint", "od", "curve_id". represent time points, optical density (od), identifier curve respectively. metadata data.frame contains "curve_id" column along metadata variables raw_od Optical density information pre-processing re-formatting. verbose logical value indicating whether output suppressed. Defaults TRUE, .e., output suppressed. fpca fpca object output FPCA fdapace umap_coord Coordinates UMAP embedding cluster_assignment data.frame matching curve_ids cluster assigned clustering() function. gpfit_info list estimated mean gp process parameters used fitting. growth_comparison results growth comparison. log_od logical indicating OD data logged. preprocessed logical variable indicating od data preprocessed preprocess_data() function. growth_parameters data.frame estimated growth parameters gp modelling

title: This S4 class represents a DGrowthR model. — DGrowthR-class
text: object valid DGrowthR, must meet following criteria: "od_data" slot must data frame containing columns "timepoint", "timepoint_n", "curve_id", "od". "metadata" slot must data frame "curve_id" column. "curve_id"s "od_data" data frame must present "curve_id" column metadata.

text: function receives dataframe optical density measurements, , optionally metadata  data frame.

code: DGrowthRFromData(od_data, metadata = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

title: Instiantiate a DGrowthR object. — DGrowthRFromData
text: od_data data.frame containing optical density data. "Time" column row timepoint rest columns individual growth curve. names growth curves match "curve_id" field metadata. metadata Optional. data.frame containing "curve_id" field additional metadata. none provided, one created automatically containing wells curve_ids od_data. verbose logical variable indicating DGrowthR object verbose.

title: Clustering Function — clustering
text: function performs clustering using specified algorithm (DBSCAN GMM) UMAP fPCA coordinates.

title: Clustering Function — clustering
code: clustering(object, ...)  # S4 method for class 'DGrowthR' clustering(   object,   embedding = "umap",   algorithm = "dbscan",   k = 0.01,   eps = NULL )

title: Clustering Function — clustering
text: object DGrowthR object containing preprocessed data including UMAP coordinates. ... Additional parameters clustering algorithm embedding string indicating coordinates "umap" "fpca" used clustering. algorithm string specifying clustering algorithm use ("dbscan" "gmm"). k Numeric value indicating number nearest neighbors (DBSCAN) number mixture components (GMM). k < 1, interpreted proportion total number curves. eps Numeric value indicating epsilon distance use DBSCAN clustering. NULL, automatic selection based k performed.

text: Updated DGrowthR object updated metadata dataframe indicating cluster membership.

code: .fit_and_estimate(   object,   model_covariate,   predict_n_steps,   downsample_every_n_timepoints,   sample_posterior_gpfit,   od_auc_at_t,   sample_n_curves,   save_gp_data,   n_cores )

title: Fit GP and gather growth parameters — .fit_and_estimate
text: object DGrowthR object containing preprocessed data. model_covariate string indicating covariate metadata pool growth curves GP modelling. predict_n_steps numeric value indicating number timepoints sample mean posterior GP fit. downsample_every_n_timepoints numeric value indicating OD every n timepoint used GP fit. Might seep fitting. sample_posterior_gpfit logical value. Indicates posterior GP sampled new growth curves parameters estimated sampled curves. Allows estimate mean standard deviation growth parameters. Really makes sense model_covariate pools one growth curve per group. od_auc_at_t numeric value indicating specific timepoint predicted OD AUC returned. sample_n_curves numeric values. sample_posterior_gpfit TRUE, sample_n_curves sampled posterior. save_gp_data logical value, indicating mean GP values GP fit parameters saved object. n_cores numeric values indicating number cores user wants use model curves parallel.

title: Fit GP and gather growth parameters — .fit_and_estimate

what: Generate predictions from a Gaussian Process model — .predict_gp
title: Generate predictions from a Gaussian Process model — .predict_gp
text: function generates predictions Gaussian Process model fitted object. function supports "alternative" "null" models. "alternative" model predicts based time contrast, "null" model predicts based time .

title: Generate predictions from a Gaussian Process model — .predict_gp

title: Estimate growth parameters — estimate_growth_parameters
code: estimate_growth_parameters(   object,   model_covariate = "curve_id",   predict_n_steps = 100,   downsample_every_n_timepoints = 1,   sample_posterior_gpfit = FALSE,   od_auc_at_t = NULL,   sample_n_curves = 100,   save_gp_data = FALSE,   n_cores = 1 )  # S4 method for class 'DGrowthR' estimate_growth_parameters(   object,   model_covariate = "curve_id",   predict_n_steps = 100,   downsample_every_n_timepoints = 1,   sample_posterior_gpfit = FALSE,   od_auc_at_t = NULL,   sample_n_curves = 100,   save_gp_data = FALSE,   n_cores = 1 )

title: Estimate growth parameters — estimate_growth_parameters
text: object DGrowthR object containing preprocessed data. model_covariate string indicating covariate metadata pool growth curves GP modelling. predict_n_steps numeric value indicating number timepoints sample mean posterior GP fit. downsample_every_n_timepoints numeric value indicating OD every n timepoint used GP fit. Might seep fitting. sample_posterior_gpfit logical value. Indicates posterior GP sampled new growth curves parameters estimated sampled curves. Allows estimate mean standard deviation growth parameters. Really makes sense model_covariate pools one growth curve per group. od_auc_at_t numeric value indicating specific timepoint predicted OD AUC returned. sample_n_curves numeric values. sample_posterior_gpfit TRUE, sample_n_curves sampled posterior. save_gp_data logical value, indicating mean GP values GP fit parameters saved object. n_cores numeric values indicating number cores user wants use model curves parallel.

title: Estimate growth parameters — estimate_growth_parameters

title: Example DGrowthR Metadata — example_metadata
text: dataset containing metadata information related different treatments properties.

title: Example DGrowthR Metadata — example_metadata
code: example_metadata

title: Example DGrowthR Metadata — example_metadata
text: data frame 150 rows 5 variables: curve_id character string indicating ID name curve. Treatment character string indicating type , concentration treatment. Conc. numeric value indicating concentration treatment. Product character string describing type product compound related treatment. example, "Cancer Medication", "Water", "DMSO", "HIV Medication". abx character string indicating whether antibiotic (relevant substance) present. Values either "abx" "no_abx".

title: Example DGrowthR Metadata — example_metadata
code: head(DGrowthR::example_metadata) #>          curve_id   Treatment Conc.           Product abx #> 1   Cancer_0.05_1 Cancer_0.05  0.05 Cancer Medication abx #> 1.1 Cancer_0.05_2 Cancer_0.05  0.05 Cancer Medication abx #> 1.2 Cancer_0.05_3 Cancer_0.05  0.05 Cancer Medication abx #> 1.3 Cancer_0.05_4 Cancer_0.05  0.05 Cancer Medication abx #> 1.4 Cancer_0.05_5 Cancer_0.05  0.05 Cancer Medication abx #> 1.5 Cancer_0.05_6 Cancer_0.05  0.05 Cancer Medication abx

title: Fit at GP model and predict the mean process — fit_predict_gp
text: df data.frame data modelled. Must timepoint, timepoint_n, curve_id, od fields. t_steps number timepoints within range od df$timepoints predict complete_sigma logical indicating whether complete covariance matrix returned. necessary want re-sample posterior. prepare_dataframe logical indicating whether data.frame mean data prepared. estimate_derivatives logical indicating whether empirical derivatives computed. delete logical indicating whether GP model deleted memory FALSE. pred_for_t numeric value inidicating specific timepoint t OD predicted

title: Fit at GP model and predict the mean process — fit_predict_gp

what: Predict the values of the fitted model to an object. — growth_comparison
title: Predict the values of the fitted model to an object. — growth_comparison
text: function fits Gaussian Process model DGrowthR object generates predictions fitted model. function supports "alternative" "null" models. "alternative" model includes time contrast predictors, "null" model includes time predictor.

title: Predict the values of the fitted model to an object. — growth_comparison
code: growth_comparison(   object,   comparison_info,   predict_n_steps = 100,   downsample_every_n_timepoints = 1,   save_gp_data = FALSE,   permutation_test = FALSE,   n_permutations = NULL,   n_cores = 1 )  # S4 method for class 'DGrowthR' growth_comparison(   object,   comparison_info,   predict_n_steps = 100,   downsample_every_n_timepoints = 1,   save_gp_data = FALSE,   permutation_test = FALSE,   n_permutations = NULL,   n_cores = 1 )

title: Predict the values of the fitted model to an object. — growth_comparison
text: object DGrowthR object model fitted predictions generated. comparison_info character vector describing contrast made. first value indicates column metadata contrast takes place. third value taken reference condition. predict_n_steps numeric value indicating number timepoints make prediction fitted GP model. points increases estimate accuracy, adds compute time. downsample_every_n_timepoints numeric value indicating OD every n timepoint used GP fit. Might speed fitting. save_gp_data logical indicating whether fitted GP models stored future analysis. permutation_test logical value indicating permutation test performed. n_permutations numerical values indicating number permutations build order gather null distribution test statistics. n_cores numeric value indicating number cores used. Useful performing permutation test.

title: Predict the values of the fitted model to an object. — growth_comparison
text: object updated growth_comparison slot.

title: Multiple Comparisons — multiple_comparisons
text: function processes multiple contrasts, performs analysis, returns data frame results. Key features include: Multiple contrast processing: Ability process analyze multiple contrasts. Comprehensive Analysis: Performs range analyses based user preferences, including Likelihood Ratio, empirical p-value, area curve (AUC) condition control, maximum growth rate condition, maximum difference, maximum optical density (OD) condition control. Output Display Formats: Provides option save results TSV file.

title: Multiple Comparisons — multiple_comparisons
code: multiple_comparisons(   object,   comparison_list,   predict_n_steps = 50,   downsample_every_n_timepoints = 1,   permutation_test = FALSE,   n_permutations = NULL,   n_cores = 1,   write_to_tsv = FALSE,   save_perm_stats = FALSE,   filename = NULL )

title: Multiple Comparisons — multiple_comparisons
text: object DGrowthR object instantiated. comparison_list list vectors. vector contains information individual contrast. predict_n_steps numeric value specifying number time points prediction. Defaults 50. downsample_every_n_timepoints numeric value indicates timepoints sampled increase fit speed permutation_test logical value indicating permutation test performed. n_permutations Number permutations permutation test (default: 100). n_cores Number cores use permutation test (default: 1). write_to_tsv logical value inndicating results save tsv file. save_perm_stats logical value indicating whether permuted test statistics stored DGrowthR object. filename Name TSV file.

title: Multiple Comparisons — multiple_comparisons
text: Provides data.frame summarizing results.

title: Perform a permutation test for the DGrowthR object — perm_test
code: perm_test(   object,   num_perms = 1000,   n.cores = 1,   predict_n_steps = 100,   gp.delete = TRUE,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'DGrowthR' perm_test(   object,   num_perms = 1000,   n.cores = 1,   predict_n_steps = 100,   gp.delete = TRUE,   ... )

title: Perform a permutation test for the DGrowthR object — perm_test
text: object DGrowthR object contains Gaussian Process regression results. num_perms number permutations perform. Defaults 1000. n.cores number CPU cores use parallel processing. Defaults 1 (parallel processing). predict_n_steps numeric value indicating number timepoints make prediction fitted GP model. points increases estimate accuracy, adds compute time. gp.delete logical value indicating whether delete GPsep identifiers permutation test. Defaults TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed GP modelling function.
